description: After the application of security updates labeled KB5044285, KB5044284, and KB5044273, Windows systems, particularly those running Windows 10 and 11 across various versions, may exhibit erratic behavior tied to mobile broadband features. Users may experience abrupt application terminations or the operating system not responding when attempting to connect to mobile networks. The driver-related updates, specifically targeting remote code execution vulnerabilities, could also lead to unexpected network disconnections, resulting in user frustration as they struggle with maintaining stable internet connectivity. In some cases, there may be prolonged delays in establishing a connection after the driver updates are applied, affecting overall productivity. Administrators should closely monitor network performance on affected systems to observe these symptoms and be prepared to revert updates if they significantly impact usability.
